name: Stoneground Barley Loaf

name: Fresh Loaf of Bread

description: A mixed bundle of breads, rolls, and sweets. Great for groups.

name: Frosted Winter Cake

name: Savory Cheese Roll

name: Honeyed Nut Clusters

name: Cracked Wheat Flatbread
description: Dry, chewy flatbread made with coarsely ground wheat. Keeps well.

name: Charred Rye Loaf
description: Overbaked rye bread with a bitter crust but edible core.

name: Day-Old Crumb Pie
description: A leftover pie sold at discount. Filling unknown.

name: Basic Wheat Loaf
description: A standard round of unsweetened wheat bread, baked daily.

name: Honey-Dappled Roll
description: A soft roll with traces of local honey brushed on top.

name: Warming Bread Loaf
description: A loaf that remains warm to the touch until broken apart.

name: Memory Tart
description: Each bite calls to mind a comforting memory, even from lifetimes past.

name: Loaf of Echoing Crust

name: Starflour Cupcake

name: Feast-in-a-Bun

name: Dreamwhisk Pastry

name: Hearthglow Tart

name: Celestial Poppy Strudel

name: Lunar Crust Turnover

name: Whimsyfluff Pocket

name: Whispering Lemon Cake

name: Blushing Velvet Gateau

name: Twilight Frost Cake
description: Covered in stardust icing, this cake encourages vivid dreams and intuitive insight.

name: Eversweet Celebration Cake

name: Sunfire Carrot Cake

name: Twilight Berry Pie

name: Pie of the Silent Thought

name: Starfire Apple Pie
description: Glistening slices of enchanted apples shimmer within. Those who eat it feel a surge of determination.

name: Mystic Mushroom Tart

name: Golden Moon Pie

name: Almond Cherry Cake

name: Golden Crust Meat Pie

name: Honey Oat Cake

name: Spiced Root Vegetable Pie

name: River Plum Tart

name: Cloudberry Cream Cake

name: Rustic Apple Pie

name: Citrus Poppy Seed Cake

name: Carrot & Walnut Loaf

name: Stonecap Stout

name: Golden Barley Lager

name: Jungle Bloom Ale

name: Traveler's Mug (Sampler Set)

name: Copper Still Kit

name: Emberbrew

name: Frostcap Draught

name: Memory Mead
description: A golden mead that enhances recollection of the day's events—for better or worse.

name: Celestial Spirits
description: A radiant bottle of starlit liquid said to grant visions of distant realms when sipped.

name: Flat Bog Ale
description: A murky, watery ale brewed in swampy lowlands. Locals swear it ‘grows on you.’

name: Stonebrew Lager

name: Sailor’s Pale Ale
description: A watery ale brewed to last on long ocean voyages.

name: Cask of Sourroot
description: A bitter brew with a vinegary aftertaste. Supposedly invigorating.

name: Old Goat’s Mild
description: Mild and slightly nutty, this ale is the favored brew of farmers and herders.

name: Sunfire Mead

name: Moonshade Stout

name: Everwinter Ale
description: Frost-covered bottle that never warms. A sip cools the body and focuses the mind.

name: Ghosthollow Pale
description: This eerie brew has no reflection and whispers echo faintly from the bottle.

name: Brewer’s Blessing (Keg)
description: When opened, the keg pours endless perfectly chilled brew—until sealed again.

name: Fizzwhistle Ale

name: Glowberry Pale Ale

name: Calm Draught

name: Rootblush Cider

name: Bard’s Bravado

name: Twilight Brew

name: Copper Cup Reserve
description: A fine ale that protects the drinker slightly from spoiled food or weak poison.

name: Everfizz Draught

name: Marbled Highland Beef Cut

name: Spiced Goat Ribs
description: Racks of ribs from hill goats, marinated in peppery spices.

name: Liver and Offal Mix
description: An economical pack of organ meats, favored by thrifty cooks and potion-makers.

name: Preserved Blood Sausage

name: Mystic Beast Cutlets

name: Brined Pork Shoulder

name: Salted Rabbit Hams

name: Spiced Venison Jerky

description: This venison carries a faint shimmer, said to bolster strength and vitality.

name: Preserved Organs (Bundle)

name: Beech-Barrel Aged Mead

name: Nectar of the Dawn Queen

description: A small locket containing a polished sliver of honeycomb. Said to calm nerves.

name: Warding Beeswax Disc
description: A carved wax medallion burned during rituals to ward off bad spirits. Faint warmth when held.

name: Bundle of Highland Turnips
description: Earthy and dense, these purple-veined roots grow best in rocky, cold terrain.

name: Orchard Apple (Crisp)
description: Bright and juicy, often enjoyed fresh or baked. A staple of many temperate settlements.

name: Braided Garlic Rope
description: Pungent bulbs braided for easy storage and sale. Used for both food and folk protections.

name: Giant Marsh Cabbage Head
description: A massive leafy vegetable that grows in wetlands, prized for its size and flavor.

name: Sun-Ripened Blood Oranges
description: Deep red citrus with a bittersweet taste, said to warm the heart when chilled.

name: Glowroot (Faintly Luminescent)
description: A pale root that glows softly in darkness, often used in stews or light enchantments.

name: Pickled Beets (Jar)
description: Tangy root vegetables preserved in vinegar, served as side dishes or travel rations.

name: Starleaf Greens
description: Delicate leafy vegetables shaped like stars, grown in shaded woodland groves.

name: Frost-Picked Berries
description: Small, ultra-sweet berries that can only be harvested after a first frost.

name: Wilted Spinach Bunch
description: Harvested late or poorly stored, these greens have lost much of their crispness.

name: Mystic Herb Sampler Pack
description: A pouch of rare herbs with slight energizing or calming properties depending on blend.

name: Sourwood Plums
description: Tiny, extremely sour fruit found in cliffside groves. Acquired taste.

name: River Mint Bunch
description: Fresh, sharp-scented mint gathered from cool riverbanks. Used in both teas and medicine.

name: Hollowfruit
description: A gourd-like fruit with a crunchy exterior and honeyed interior. Popular festival treat.

name: Wilted Onion Set
description: A bag of small sprouted onions past their prime, sold cheaply to frugal buyers.

name: Skyroot Stalks
description: Tall, blue-veined plants that release a faint static when touched. Used in old rites.

name: Jungle Banaberries
description: Clusters of rich, dark berries with an earthy aftertaste. Known to stain fingers deeply.

name: Fungal Truffle Puff
description: A savory fungus ball that releases a rich aroma when sliced. Highly sought after.

name: Tundra Radish
description: Hardy root vegetable with a sharp bite. Popular in stews where food is scarce.

name: Moonglow Melon Slice
description: Faintly shimmering fruit said to ease dreams and calm nerves when eaten before sleep.

name: Crate of Soft Carrots
description: Misshapen and rubbery, these vegetables are often used for soup stock or animal feed.

name: Ashroot
description: Grey-streaked root used by desert folk in rituals and potent medicines. Bitter and strong.

name: Everbloom Petals
description: Vibrant, edible petals that remain fresh for weeks. Used as garnish and in fae celebrations.

name: Starfall Fig
description: A glitter-speckled fruit said to only grow where stars have landed. Eating it fills one with a brief sense of awe.

name: Fireplum
description: A spicy fruit that warms the mouth and never bruises. Said to help travelers resist cold winds.

name: Whisperapple
description: Biting into this pale blue fruit causes faint melodic whispers to be heard for several minutes.

name: Sunburst Citrus
description: Glows softly in darkness and provides a minor boost to alertness. Often used in breakfast rituals.

name: Gloamberry Cluster
description: These berries glow faintly in moonlight and are favored in fae wines. Their juice has mild calming effects.

name: Glasspeach
description: Its skin is translucent and refracts light like crystal. It shatters like spun sugar when bitten.

name: Wyrmfruit
description: Found near ancient draconic lairs, this scaled fruit gives a fleeting rush of courage.

name: Breezeberry
description: Ethereal and almost weightless, these berries glide slowly when dropped. Popular in elven cuisine.

name: Glowroot
description: A luminescent root vegetable that emits a soft light, useful for underground kitchens or nighttime cooking.

name: Stormleaf
description: Large dark green leaves crackling faintly with static energy. Used in potions to enhance reflexes.

name: Frostpepper
description: A chilly, crisp pepper that imparts a cool sensation and is prized by chefs and alchemists alike.

name: Verdant Bloom
description: This rare flowering vegetable blooms only once a year, said to carry the blessings of the earth.

name: Ironvine
description: A tough vine vegetable with iron-like fibers. Chewing it is said to strengthen one’s resolve.

name: Mooncarrot
description: Pale carrots that seem to glow faintly under moonlight, favored by herbalists and seers.

name: Emberturnip
description: A root vegetable with a faint warm glow, believed to help recover from cold ailments.

name: Silversprout
description: Tiny sprouts with a silvery sheen. Eating them is said to sharpen the senses briefly.

name: Spikewheat
description: A hardy grain with tough stalks that seem almost impervious to damage; used for making bread that lasts.

name: Crushed Red Pepper
description: A basic blend of dried chili flakes used to add heat and flavor to many dishes.

name: Saffron Threads
description: Rare and valuable spice harvested from delicate flowers, prized for its color and aroma.

name: Star Anise
description: A fragrant spice shaped like a star, used in teas and culinary dishes for its licorice flavor.

name: Dust of Serenity
description: A fine powder that when added to food induces calmness and clarity of mind.

name: Phantom Pepper
description: A ghostly white chili with a sharp bite, said to momentarily numb the tongue.

name: Essence of Basilisk
description: A rare resin with a faint shimmer, used in potent magical brews and exotic cooking.

name: Golden Cinnamon
description: A rare variety of cinnamon bark with a rich golden hue and potent warming qualities.

name: Dragon's Breath Pepper

name: Whispering Sage
description: Leaves infused with faint whispers of forgotten knowledge when burned or brewed.

name: Wild Thyme
description: A common herb with a slightly pungent aroma, used in everyday cooking and healing remedies.

name: Amber Resin
description: A fragrant, sticky resin harvested from ancient trees, prized for its use in incense and potions.

name: Fire Lotus Powder
description: A rare powder derived from a mystical flower, adds a warming sensation and subtle energy to dishes.

name: Phantom Cinnamon Bark
description: This dark cinnamon bark emits a faint shimmer and is said to be harvested from trees touched by spirits.

name: Celestial Nutmeg

name: Silverleaf Basil

name: Blazing Saffron
description: A fiery variant of saffron, its threads burn with a warm glow and are prized by alchemists.

name: Frostmint Leaves

name: Gilded Clove Pods
description: Clove pods with a delicate golden sheen, used in high-end perfumes and spell components.

name: Storm Peppercorns

name: Trader’s Special Spice Blend

name: Dragonfire Seasoning
description: A fiery blend of rare peppers and enchanted herbs, said to ignite the palate with a lingering warmth.

name: Emberleaf Pepper
